com.busit

Interface Producer


  • public interface Producer

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Message produce(Channel out, Content data)
      Produce data for the selected output channel.
      Message sample(Channel out)
      Produce sample data for the selected output channel Upon activation, this method will be called once for each meaningful 'out' (that have at least one chained app).
      boolean test()
      Test preconditions for this app.

    • Method Detail

      • produce

        Message produce(Channel out,
              Content data)
                throws Exception
        Produce data for the selected output channel. In case activation of this app was triggered by a CRON, this method will be called only once for the target 'out' channel and the 'data' will be null.
        Parameters:
        out - the desired output channel
        data - Optional PUSH data that triggered activation of this method
        Returns:
        The produced message(s) or null if nothing is produced.
        Throws:
        Exception - If any exception is thrown, it has the same effect as calling App.notifyOwner(e.getMessage(), e) and then returning null.

      • sample

        Message sample(Channel out)
               throws Exception
        Produce sample data for the selected output channel Upon activation, this method will be called once for each meaningful 'out' (that have at least one chained app).
        Parameters:
        out - The desired output channel.
        Returns:
        The produced message or null if nothing is produced.
        Throws:
        Exception - If any exception is thrown, it has the same effect as calling App.notifyOwner(e.getMessage(), e) and then returning null.

      • test

        boolean test()
             throws Exception
        Test preconditions for this app. The current instance will be fully populated and configured. Implementation should check its own dependencies and the current settings.
        Returns:
        true if the app instance meets all preconditions, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - If any exception is thrown, it has the same effect as calling App.notifyOwner(e.getMessage(), e), and then returning false.
